result.execSummary:
The defendant Deleon W. Howard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Deleon W. Howard is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Deleon W. Howard was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Deleon W. Howard was found guilty of Criminal Trespass to Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.
  • Deleon W. Howard was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes: TO BE PAID WHILE ON PROBATION ON CTS 3 & 4.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Costs on Count 2 to be paid while on probation on Cts 3 & 4.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Pay DNA surcharge.
*   Pay costs of legal representation or Advocate Counsel fees for the defense of the case, to be determined within 60 days.
*   Pay restitution in the sum of $180 plus surcharges - Joint & Severally w/ co-deft.
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not have contact with Damion VanBoven, Sam Brantley or Azrial Raasch, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  Expungement Review on 11/25/15 @ 8:30am.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.addlTxt: Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Def. appeared without counsel.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Def. has been unable to pay financial obligations but requests more time to pay.  Def. is employed.  State requests def. be allowed 60 more days to pay.  No further hearings scheduled.  When financial obligations have been paid in full, def. can file a petition for expungement, which the court will consider without a hearing.
Appearance Notice signed by defendant for 1/20/16 at 8:30.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Def. appeared without counsel.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Def. is requesting expungement of record.  Per call and email from probation agent Michelle Pounders, def. has successfully completed probation and paid the financial obligations prior to discharge date.  On discharge date, Ms. Pounders was notified by the fiscal division of the clerk's office that an error was made and def. owes an additional $453.00.  Court will allow def. time to pay the $453.00.  Hearing re expungement adj. to 1/20/16 at 8:30.
Terminated regular on 11/25/15
Counts 3 and 4 are paid in full to DOC - $453 still due on count 2

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney David Celebre.  Clerk: PT
Case is resolved; plea questionnaire filed.  State is compliant with victim rights notification.  Count 1 - Dismissed by the State.  Deft. pleads Guilty to Counts 2, 3 and 4; found guilty by the court.  Sentencing arguments made.
Count 2 - Deft. sentenced to 158 days in KCJ, but given credit for time already served.  Costs and surcharge to be paid during probation in Counts 3 & 4.
Counts 3 & 4 -  Sentence is withheld; Deft. placed on probation for 1 year with conditions concurrent to each other.  As a condition court imposes and stays 9 months in the KCJ. Restitution ordered in the amount of $180 joint & severally with co-deft.  No contact with Damion V., Sam B., or Azrial R.  Appeal Rights given.  Expungement Review on 11/25/15 at 8:30 AM.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Atty Celebre appears on behalf of Defendant who is in custody.  Clerk: PT
Defendant's appearance is waived for this hearing.  Atty Celebre states there is no appearance by any representative from DOC.  Arguments heard on Atty Celebre's motion for which he is seeking a copy of the statement the alleged victim gave to his probation agent.  Atty Graveley states he has no authority over what is being sought from DOC.  Atty Celebre states he will provide an affidavit of mailing to the court on what was sent to DOC.  Upon filing affidavit court will order the Dept. of Corrections to release a copy of victim's statement to Atty Celebre.  Atty Celebre to draft the order.  Trial remains as scheduled on 12/1/14 at 8:30 AM.
